member.name: T:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous
member.summary: Offers a simple way to communicate with a TCP remote device. You don't have to care about the asynchronous communication in detail. The only thing to do is opening a connection and send messages or wait for received messages. All callbacks are handled by few events. Received messages are returned without \r\n on their ends.

member.name: T:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient
member.summary: Interface for easy-to-use TCP clients.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.connect
member.summary: Connects the client to a remote TCP host using the specified host name and port number.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the client from the remote device.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.Connected
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that determines whether this client is connected to a remote host.

member.name: E:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.ConnectionStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the connection status changes, e.g. from Disconnected to Connected

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding used when communicating with the remote device.

member.name: E:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.ExceptionOccured
member.summary: Occurs with an Exception during communication.

member.name: E:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.MessageReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a message is received from the remote device.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the delimiter for delimiting the messages from each other. Default is line-break '\n'.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.ITcpClient.AutoReconnect
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that determines whether the TcpClient should try to reconnect a lost connection.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialisiert eine neue Instanz von AsynchronousConnection.
member.param: Der Host-Name des TCP-Servers, z.B.: "localhost"
Der Port am TCP-Server, z.B. 80

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.handleException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Tritt eine Exception auf, so sollte diese an den Callback-Handler weitergereicht werden und die Verbindung geschlossen werden. Dies kann bequem durch einen Aufruf von handleException() geschehen.
member.param: Die übergebene Exception

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.connect
member.summary: Connects the client to a remote TCP host using the specified host name and port number.

member.summary: Wird aufgerufen, wenn der Connect-Vorgang abgeschlossen ist.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.disconnect
member.summary: Trennt die Socket-Verbindung.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.send(System.String)
member.summary: Sendet eine Nachricht an den Client. Die Nachricht wird automatisch um den Message-Delimiter erweitert.
member.param: Die Nachricht, die gesendet werden soll.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.sendCallback(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Wird aufgerufen, wenn Daten gesendet werden.

member.summary: Sets up the state object and then calls the BeginReceive method to read the data from the client socket asynchronously.
member.param: The socket

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.autoReconnectTimerCallback(System.Object)
member.summary: Wird aufgerufen, um periodisch eine Verbindung wiederaufzubauen, wenn diese abgebrochen wurde und der AutoReconnect aktiviert ist.

member.name: E:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.ConnectionStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the connection status changes, e.g. from Disconnected to Connected

member.summary: Occurs when a message is received from the remote device.

member.summary: Occurs with an Exception during communication.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.Encoding
member.summary: Erlaubt es, die Encodierungs-Variante für den Datenaustausch abzufragen und zu ändern. Standardmäßig wird Encoding.Default benutzt, die Standard-ANSI-code-page des Systems.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the delimiter for delimiting the messages from each other. Default is line-break '\n'.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Net.TcpClientAsynchronous.AutoReconnect
member.summary: Fragt ab oder legt fest, ob versucht werden soll, die Verbindung nach einem Abbruch automatisch wiederherzustellen.

member.name: T:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow
member.summary: Allows you to send simulated Key-Pressed-Events to an external Application. Attention: This class is definitely not in a final and well tested state.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance, that sends the keyboard events "blindly". That means, it doesn't send it to a specified windows, but to the window that is active at the moment.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the keyboard events to a specified window. This is achieved by first bringing the specified window to the front and sending the keyboard event afterwards.
member.param: Class of the specified window. If set to NULL, all class names match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.
Title of the specified window. If set to NULL, all window titles match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get a handle to an application window.
member.param: Class of the specified window. If set to NULL, all class names match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.
Title of the specified window. If set to NULL, all window titles match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.SetForegroundWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the specified window to be the active window.
member.param: The handle of the window.
member.returns: A flag indicating the operation's success.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.bringWindowToFront
member.summary: Activates the window that matches the current setting of window class and window title.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.findWindow
member.summary: Searches for a window that matches the current setting of window class and window title.
member.returns: An int pointer representing the found window or IntPtr.Zero if no adequate window was found.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.sendKey(de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.Keys)
member.summary: That's just a dummy method in order to pay attention to the Keys class. Unfortunately there's no easy way to use string enums in C#. But a possible way is presented in http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/StringEnum.asp

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.sendKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the keys you define. If you want to know how to create special keys or key combinations not defined in the class ExternalWindow.Keys please have a look at the microsoft msdn homepage.
member.param: The key (or combination of keys) to send to the external application.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.WindowClass
member.summary: Class of the specified window. If set to NULL, all class names match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.controls.ExternalWindow.WindowTitle
member.summary: Title of the specified window. If set to NULL, all window titles match. HINT: You can discover the correct setting by using Spy++.

member.name: T:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1
member.summary:
Class for storing configuration properties in XML files. All public (and serializable) properties of a class can be stored in an XML file automatically.
You just have to derive your class from Configuration and pass the type of your class as type parameter, such as public class Config : Configuration<Config>
The settings are then available through the static property 'Settings', e.g.: Config.Settings.MyInteger
To store the current settings in an XML file use the static method Config.save().
member.typeparam: The class that contains the properties you want to store in an XML file.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.#cctor
member.summary: Static initialization. If there's a config file for the type of settings, the data specified in it is being loaded automatically.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.load
member.summary: Tries to load a stored snapshot of the object from an XML file. The filename is generated by using the name of the object's type.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.fileExists
member.summary: Checks for the existence of the configuration file.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.load(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to load a snapshot of the object from the specified XML file.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.resetToDefault
member.summary: Resets the settings to the default values.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.save
member.summary: Create a "snapshot" of the object and store it in an XML-file. The filename is automatically created by using the object's type-name.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.save(System.String)
member.summary: Create a "snapshot" of the object and store it in the XML-file with the specified filename.
member.param: Name of the output file

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.configuration.Configuration`1.Settings
member.summary: Gets or sets the properties of this configuration-object.

member.summary: Provides a generic serializer/deserializer for .NET structs.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.StructSerializer`1.deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a struct from an array of bytes. If the number of bytes passed to this function doesn't match the size of the struct you want to build, a default instance of the struct is returned.
member.param: The bytes that should build the struct.
member.returns: A struct that was built using the given byte array.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.StructSerializer`1.serialize(`0)
member.summary: Serializes a given struct to an array of bytes, so that it can be easily transferred over streams such as file streams or network streams.
member.param: The struct you want to serialize.

member.summary: Implements a simple tree.
member.typeparam: The type that you want to store in this tree.

member.name: T:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1
member.summary: Defines the operations available on a simple tree.

member.name: M:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.clear
member.summary: Resets the current tree to it's root.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data object connected to this node.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent of the current node or null if the current node is the tree's root.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.IsRoot
member.summary: Indicates whether the current node is the root of the tree.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Root
member.summary: Gets the root of this tree.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Children
member.summary: Gets the current node's children.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Siblings
member.summary: Gets the current node's siblings. (all nodes with the same parent, including the node itself)

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets the sibling before the current node or null if there isn't a previous sibling.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets the sibling after the current node or null if there isn't a next sibling.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Depth
member.summary: Gets the depth of the current node. The depth is the distance from the current node to the root of the tree. That means how deep the current node is 'hidden' in the hierarchy of the tree. Root has a depth of 0, a child of root has a depth of 1.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.INodeTree`1.Degree
member.summary: Return the number of children the current node has. (also called out-degree)

member.summary: Gets the current node's children.

member.summary: Returns the parent of the current node or null if the current node is the tree's root.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.NodeTree`1.Root
member.summary: Gets the root of this tree.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.NodeTree`1.Depth
member.summary: Gets the depth of the current node. The depth is the distance from the current node to the root of the tree. That means how deep the current node is 'hidden' in the hierarchy of the tree. Root has a depth of 0, a child of root has a depth of 1.

member.name: P:de.christianleberfinger.dotnet.pocketknife.Collections.NodeTree`1.IsRoot
member.summary: Indicates whether the current node is the root of the tree.
